result.execSummary:
The defendant John Wayne Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Restitution set at zero, all court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge, all applicable fees of supervision.
Court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec.  973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count. Credit for 78 days.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Request for Sentence Modification signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for sentence modification.

Per Order signed on 9/11/2015:  JOC for count one shall be amended to reflect total length of sentence of 45 months, bifurcated into 21 months Initial Confinement and 24 months of Extended Supervision.
Order GRANTING Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defense attorney.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  crt
from DOC requesting review of JOC.
Count one
Count three.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 45 MONTHS with 78 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 21 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 25 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 78 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Redacted Criminal Complaint Provided by the Defense
Sentencing Memorandum

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant John Wayne Smith in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant John Wayne Smith in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  The repeater enhancer is Count 3 is DISMISSED.  As to Counts 1 & 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING  (15 pages) commencing APRIL 3, 2015 received and filed.

AttorneyJeffrey Szczewski for Justin Singleton in court, defendant John Wayne Smith not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Wayne Smith in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant John Wayne Smith in custody. Thomas Potter on behalf of Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Kenneth Justus, Officer - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 2806 West Forest Home Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Absolute Sobriety to be monitored by drug testing and breathalyzer tests.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Wayne Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant John Wayne Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters pleas of Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
